definitions.definition: pull or rip (something) apart or to pieces with force.
remove by pulling or ripping forcefully.
synonyms: pluck; informalyank "Gina tore the book from his hands"

definitions.definition: make a hole or split in (something) by pulling it or piercing it with a sharp implement.
examples: she was always tearing her clothes

definitions.definition: make (a hole or split) in something by force.
examples: the blast tore a hole in the wall

definitions.definition: damage (a muscle or ligament) by overstretching it.
examples: he tore a ligament playing squash

definitions.definition: move very quickly, typically in a reckless or excited manner.
examples: she tore along the footpath on her bike
synonyms: hightail it "Jack tore down the street"

definitions.definition: be in a state of uncertainty between two conflicting options or parties.
examples: he was torn between his duty and his better instincts

definitions.definition: a hole or split in something caused by it having been pulled apart forcefully.
examples: rip, hole, split, slash, slit; snag a tear in her dress

definitions.definition: a spell of great success or excellence in performance.
examples: he went on a tear, winning three out of every four hands

definitions.definition: a brief spell of erratic behavior; a binge or spree.
examples: every so often she goes on a tear, walking around town and zapping people with orange spray paint

definitions.definition: a drop of clear salty liquid secreted from glands in a person's eye when they cry or when the eye is irritated.
examples: teardrop; Moredrop, droplet "tears in her eyes"Moredrop, droplet tears in her eyes

definitions.definition: the state or action of crying.
examples: he was so hurt by her attitude he was nearly in tears
the freezing wind made her eyes tear
